	The Senior Accountant is responsible for overseeing all accounting operations, ensuring strong financial governance and compliance, and providing financial analysis to support strategic business decisions.
	The role ensures accurate financial reporting, cost control, inventory and asset management, profitability analysis, and compliance with industry-specific regulations.
	The Senior Accountant will report to the General Manager, working closely with management, sales, operations, and services teams to optimize revenue, manage high-value assets/equipment, maintain strong cash flow, and drive overall financial performance.


Responsibilities
Financial Reporting and Analysis:


	Lead the preparation of accurate and timely monthly, annual, and statutory financial statements (P&amp;L, Balance Sheet, Cash Flow) in compliance with relevant standards (e.g., GAAP/IFRS). Conduct variance analysis and provide insights for business decisions


Budgeting and Forecasting:


	Manage the annual budgeting process, perform financial feasibility analysis and develop long-term financial models for capital-intensive operations


Cost Management and Sales Profitability:


	Oversee costing for machinery / spare parts sales, and maintenance services. Ensure accurate cost allocation, price equipment usage


Audits and External Liaison:


	Strengthen and coordinate all internal and external audits across procurement, inventory, sales, and finance processes, acting as the primary liaison with auditors, banks, and regulatory bodies


Cash Flow and Treasury Management:


	Manage cash flow, including forecasting needs, planning for foreign currency risks, and overseeing daily treasury functions.

	Implement process automation of financial modules in ERP systems (e.g., SAP, Oracle, Microsoft Dynamics, Tally, etc.). Optimize and drive continuous improvement initiatives

	Lead and mentor the finance teams.
	Present financial insights to executive management.


Requirements


	A Bachelor&rsquo;s Degree in Accounting, Finance, or a related field is required. MBA or professional certification (ACCA, CPA, ICAN) highly preferred
	10+ years experience in financial management, accounting, or auditing, with several years in a leadership role, is expected.

	Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills
	High level of integrity and ethical behavior
	Excellent leadership, communication, team management, and decision-making abilities
	Industry Knowledge
	Must understand heavy equipment dealership operations
	Machinery sales, rental, leasing, and maintenance business models &bull; High-value asset management and importation costing (duty, freight, clearing)


Salary

Senior Accountant Job at Mactay Consulting




        
    

        
        Mactay Consulting is a leading management consulting firm in Nigeria, providing HR Consulting, Learning & Development Solutions, Outsourcing and Contact Centre Solutions.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Senior Accountant

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: TBA
Reports To: General Manager – Nigeria
Industry: Heavy Equipment (Construction, Mining, Agriculture)

Job Description
     

            
    




	The Senior Accountant is responsible for overseeing all accounting operations, ensuring strong financial governance and compliance, and providing financial analysis to support strategic business decisions.
	The role ensures accurate financial reporting, cost control, inventory and asset management, profitability analysis, and compliance with industry-specific regulations.
	The Senior Accountant will report to the General Manager, working closely with management, sales, operations, and services teams to optimize revenue, manage high-value assets/equipment, maintain strong cash flow, and drive overall financial performance.


Responsibilities
Financial Reporting and Analysis:


	Lead the preparation of accurate and timely monthly, annual, and statutory financial statements (P&L, Balance Sheet, Cash Flow) in compliance with relevant standards (e.g., GAAP/IFRS). Conduct variance analysis and provide insights for business decisions


Budgeting and Forecasting:


	Manage the annual budgeting process, perform financial feasibility analysis and develop long-term financial models for capital-intensive operations


Cost Management and Sales Profitability:


	Oversee costing for machinery / spare parts sales, and maintenance services. Ensure accurate cost allocation, price equipment usage


Audits and External Liaison:


	Strengthen and coordinate all internal and external audits across procurement, inventory, sales, and finance processes, acting as the primary liaison with auditors, banks, and regulatory bodies


Cash Flow and Treasury Management:


	Manage cash flow, including forecasting needs, planning for foreign currency risks, and overseeing daily treasury functions.


ERP & Process Improvement:


	Implement process automation of financial modules in ERP systems (e.g., SAP, Oracle, Microsoft Dynamics, Tally, etc.). Optimize and drive continuous improvement initiatives


Leadership and Stakeholder Management:


	Lead and mentor the finance teams.
	Present financial insights to executive management.


Requirements


	A Bachelor’s Degree in Accounting, Finance, or a related field is required. MBA or professional certification (ACCA, CPA, ICAN) highly preferred
	10+ years experience in financial management, accounting, or auditing, with several years in a leadership role, is expected.
	Experience ideally in heavy machinery/equipment, construction, or manufacturing, automotive or industrial sectors is a strong advantage
	Strong knowledge of IFRS, taxation, cost accounting, and inventory management
	Expertise in financial modelling, forecasting, budgeting, and variance analysis
	Proficient in financial analysis tools and software, including ERP systems and MSOffice suite (especially Excel and Word)
	Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills
	High level of integrity and ethical behavior
	Excellent leadership, communication, team management, and decision-making abilities
	Industry Knowledge
	Must understand heavy equipment dealership operations
	Machinery sales, rental, leasing, and maintenance business models • High-value asset management and importation costing (duty, freight, clearing)


Salary
N1,000,000 – N1,500,000 Monthly.

Sales Manager Job at Mactay Consulting




        
    

        
        Mactay Consulting is a leading management consulting firm in Nigeria, providing HR Consulting, Learning & Development Solutions, Outsourcing and Contact Centre Solutions.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Sales Manager
Job Locations: Northern Nigeria / Southern Nigeria (Multiple States as assigned per region)
Employment Type: Fixed-Term Contract
Reports To: Head of Sales / General Manager – Nigeria
Industry: Heavy Equipment (Construction, Mining, Agriculture)

Job Summary
     

            
    




	To lead and manage the sales operations for heavy equipment and machinery, driving revenue growth through strategic business development, client relationship management, and coordination with technical, after-sales, and service teams.
	The Sales Manager will identify and pursue new market opportunities across mining, construction, and industrial sectors, ensuring the achievement of sales targets and customer satisfaction.


Key Responsibilities
Business Development & Sales Execution:


	Develop and execute strategic sales plans to achieve company sales targets for heavy equipment and machinery (e.g., bulldozers, tractors, loaders, excavators, crushers, etc.).
	Identify, pursue, and close new business opportunities with clients in the mining, construction, quarrying, and industrial sectors.
	Lead proposal development, contract negotiations, and presentations to prospective clients.
	Manage the entire sales cycle from lead generation to deal closure and after-sales follow-up.


Market & Customer Management:


	Build and maintain long-term relationships with key customers, EPC firms, project developers, and government agencies.
	Conduct regular market research to identify new trends, opportunities, and competitive activities.
	Maintain a customer database (CRM) and ensure regular client engagement. • Develop marketing strategies, including trade fairs, demos, and product launches.


Team & Stakeholder Coordination:


	Work closely with management, sales and after-sales teams to align sales objectives with equipment availability, specifications, and delivery timelines.
	Support the service and parts departments in ensuring customer satisfaction post-sale. • Supervise and mentor sales representatives and technicians.


Reporting & Performance Management:


	Prepare periodic sales forecasts, reports, and market intelligence updates for management.
	Track and report on key performance indicators (KPIs) such as sales volume, margins, and market share.
	Recommend pricing strategies and promotional campaigns to improve market penetration.


Qualifications


	Bachelor’s Degree in engineering, sales, or related discipline; An MBA is a plus.
	10+ years of experience of proven sale and maintenance of heavy equipment, machinery, or industrial products sector.
	Demonstrated success in B2B sales and project-based selling.
	Existing network with EPC companies, contractors, and industrial clients preferred.
	Strong understanding of construction, mining or agricultural heavy machinery and working knowledge of equipment types (e.g., bulldozers, tractors, loaders, excavators, crushers, etc.)
	Comfortable working in a target-driven role.
	High commercial acumen and ability to close complex deals.
	Strong research and networking abilities.
	Required to maintain the profitability of their departments while controlling expenses and maintaining customer satisfaction
	Ability to work independently with minimal supervision and deliver results.
	Strong interpersonal, written, and verbal communication skills.
	Proficient in CRM tools and MS Office suite (especially Excel and Word).
	Leadership and team management ability.
	Must have a valid driver’s license and willingness to travel extensively within states in the Nigerian region assigned.

N1,000,000 – N1,500,000 monthly

Assistant Brand Manager Job at Mactay Consulting




        
    

        
        Mactay Consulting is a leading management consulting firm in Nigeria, providing HR Consulting, Learning & Development Solutions, Outsourcing and Contact Centre Solutions.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Assistant Brand Manager

Job Location: Lagos 
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary 
Broad objectives of the role are:
     

            
    




	To assure the long term growth of the organisation through the continuous development of its brands in line with the Company’s brand strategies.
	To contribute to the achievement of Net Sales, Market Shares and Brand Equity objectives through the implementation of the annual marketing plan across specific brand responsibilities.
	To develop strong competencies in Brand Management and Shopper Marketing the Beiersdorf way.


Responsibilities
Annual Marketing Plan:


	Provide input for the development of the annual Marketing Plan as per PMP and ABP requirements (including category developments, product performance, pricing analysis, and competitor analysis)
	Propose brand activity and measurable objectives in line with the organisation Brand investment strategy and available budgets
	Support Brand Managers and teams in the development of detailed category and competitor reviews, communication and promotional plans, brand activations, as well as launch execution of NPDs
	Monitor brand performance and implement approved changes to the activity plans throughout the year


Consumer Understanding & Insights:


	Critically observe consumers and shoppers. Develop an understanding of them through regular direct contact and research, understanding their environment, habits, attitudes
	Work with Brand Team and agencies to implement approved consumer research based on business knowledge gaps and requirements
	Master the in-touch process and its application in innovation and communication development.


New Product Development:


	Work with Brand managers and Sales team in order to develop and present all launch/re-launch campaigns at monthly S&OP meetings to ensure buy-in
	Follow the Launch/Re-launch SOP in order to achieve fast, efficient launches to market.


Brand Performance:


	Monitor the development of Net Sales and Market Shares in line with the Annual Marketing Plan via monthly performance analysis & reporting
	Work with Supply/demand in order to achieve forecast accuracy targets for assigned categories.


Requirements


	Good degree in Marketing or any Business related Course.
	Minimum of 3 years of experience in an FMCG company or agency industry.
	Good organizational & analytical skills.
	Excellent influencing and communication skills.
	Takes responsibility, self-motivated and uses initiative.
	Strong team player and willing to support.


Salary


	N650,000 Net Monthly and other benefits.

Accounts Officer Job at Sales Force Consulting




        
    

        
        Sales Force Consulting -  Our client runs a large-scale, modern poultry farm with capacity to breed thousands of birds in their farm located at Awkuzu, Anambra State where they process live chickens.

Their vision is to rank amongst the leading frozen chicken suppliers and distributors in the South East in the coming years.

They are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Accounts Officer

Job Location: Awkuzu, Anambra
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities
     

            
    




	General book-keeping ensuring that all financial transactions are captured through the company’s accounting software
	Carry out periodic and prompt reconciliations with bankers, debtors and creditors by monitoring account statements regularly to ensure they tally with the company’s records with zero tolerance for and prompt recovery of excess charges.

	First Degree / HND in Accounting, Finance or related field.
	Applicants must possess between 1 - 3 years accounting work experience.


Other Conditions:


	Proven experience in accounting role in a company
	Ideal candidate should presently reside or can easily procure accommodation in Awkuzu.

	Ability to develop and implement cost saving measures
	Ability to work independently with little supervision.

	Proficiency in accounting software (e.g., QuickBooks, SAP, or industry-specific software).
	Strong Excel skill
	Ability to analyze financial data, identify trends, and provide insights to improve business performance.
	Strong verbal and written communication skills to convey complex financial information clearly to stakeholders.
	Strong attention to detail to ensure accuracy in financial reporting.


Salary
N110,000 monthly.

Interview mode
Physical.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV (PDF or Word) to: salesforceconsultingng@gmail.com using “ACCOUNTS OFFICER” as the subject of the email.

	Coordinate external audits and provide required documentation

	B.Sc. / HND in Accounting, Finance, or a related field
	Professional certification (ICAN, ACCA, or equivalent) is an advantage
	4 - 6 years of relevant accounting experience
	Proficiency in accounting software and MS Excel

	Financial reporting and analysis

	Knowledge of Nigerian tax regulations
	Strong organizational and analytical skills

Accountant Job at Excel and Grace Consulting




        
    

        
        Excel and Grace Consulting is a fast-paced business consulting organization with a track record of delivering exceptional business solutions to small and medium-scale enterprises in Nigeria, Ghana, Germany, Switzerland, Canada, etc. We are certified management consultants with the International Council of Management Consulting Institutes (CMC-Global) with over 18 years of experience. Our team of experts and consultants have authored over 20 books on business management, business structure, business operations, human resources, organizational structure, employee development, money management, and so on.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Accountant
     

            
    



Job Location: Wuse 2, Abuja (FCT)
Employment Type: Full-Time
Industry: Computer Systems & Electronics

Job Summary


	The Accountant will manage the financial records and reporting for the group, ensuring accuracy, compliance, and transparency in all financial transactions.
	The role supports management decision-making through timely financial analysis and reporting.


Key Responsibilities


	Maintain complete and accurate accounting records for all group entities
	Prepare monthly, quarterly, and annual financial statements
	Manage accounts payable, accounts receivable, and general ledger entries
	Monitor cash flow, bank reconciliations, and expense controls
	Prepare budgets, forecasts, and variance analysis reports
	Ensure compliance with tax laws, statutory deductions, and regulatory requirements
	Coordinate external audits and provide required documentation
	Implement and maintain internal financial controls


Qualifications & Experience


	B.Sc. / HND in Accounting, Finance, or a related field
	Professional certification (ICAN, ACCA, or equivalent) is an advantage
	4 - 6 years of relevant accounting experience
	Proficiency in accounting software and MS Excel


Key Competencies:


	Financial reporting and analysis
	Attention to detail and accuracy
	Knowledge of Nigerian tax regulations
	Strong organizational and analytical skills


Salary


	N350,000 – N400,000 monthly.
